clinical_study.brief_title: Non-interventional Study of Therapy for Threatened Miscarriage
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter Open Prospective Comparative Non-interventional Study of Therapy for Threatened Miscarriage With Medicinal Products Utrogestan, 200 mg Capsules (Besins Healthcare SA, Belgium), and Duphaston, 10 mg Coated Tablets (Abbott Healthcare Products B.V., the Netherlands)

brief_summary.textblock: Study the efficacy and safety of therapy for threatened miscarriage with medicinal products Utrogestan (micronized progesterone), 200 mg capsules (Besins Healthcare SA, Belgium), and Duphaston (Dydrogesterone), 10 mg coated tablets (Abbott Healthcare Products B.V., the Netherlands)

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion (until the date of patient discharge from hospital, an averade 7-14 days)
primary_outcome.description: Discharge from the hospital with prolonged pregnancy

secondary_outcome.measure: Speed of arrest of acute symptoms of threatened miscarriage
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion (until the date of patient discharge from hospital, an averade 7-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Speed of arrest of symptoms of threatened miscarriage (blood discharge from the genital tract and drawing pains in the lower abdomen)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion (until the date of patient discharge from hospital, an averade 7-14 days)
Through study completion (until the date of patient discharge from hospital, an averade 7-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Severity of patient's condition dynamically in the course of therapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion (until the date of patient discharge from hospital, an averade 7-14 days)
secondary_outcome.description: Psycho-emotional status of women dynamically in the course of therapy

other_outcome.time_frame: From the moment of signing of informed consent through study completion (until the date of patient discharge from hospital, an averade 7-14 days)
other_outcome.description: All adverse events (AE) and serious adverse events (SAE) will be recorded during the study

arm_group.description: Utrogestan, 200 mg orally thrice a day until acute symptoms of the threat of termination of pregnancy (scarlet discharge from the genital tract, pain in the abdomen) and then Utrogestan vaginally 200 mg twice a day and 200 mg orally once a day before bed
Utrogestan vaginally 200 mg twice a day and 200 mg orally once a day before bed
Duphaston, orally 40 mg once, then 10 mg every 8 hours until the symptoms disappear

intervention.description: Utrogestan, 200 mg orally thrice a day until acute symptoms of the threat of termination of pregnancy (scarlet discharge from the genital tract, pain in the abdomen) and then Utrogestan vaginally 200 mg twice a day and 200 mg orally once a day before bed
Utrogestan vaginally 200 mg twice a day and 200 mg orally once a day before bed
Duphaston, orally 40 mg once, then 10 mg every 8 hours until the symptoms disappear

study_pop.textblock: Women aged 18-35 years with a confirmed threat of miscarriage with a gestation period of 8 to 22 full weeks.
